title: ICBC provides $80 million loan for Taliabu Island Iron Ore Project
description: In 2018, ICBC and PT Servindo Jaya Utama — a special purpose vehicle and wholly-owned subsidiary of Salim Group — signed an $80 million loan agreement for the Taliabu Iron Ore Project. The borrower was expected to use the proceeds of the loan to finance a commercial contract that it signed with Metallurgical Corporation of China (MCC) on September 9, 2015. The project involved the construction of a high-grade iron ore processing mill on Taliabu Island in North Maluku.   The project scope included the installation of a long-distance belt conveyor transportation system and concentration and tailing system, installation of mechanical equipment, pipeline and electric equipment, single and linkage commission, no-load and load test, etc. Upon completion, the mill was expected to produce 35 million tons of iron ore annually. Metallurgical Corporation of China (MCC) was the contractor responsible the implementation of the project. Construction started on January 18, 2016, and the project was completed on November 28, 2017.
staff_comments: The Chinese project title is '印度尼西亚塔岛铁矿项目'.
combined_text:
# Sector
INDUSTRY, MINING, CONSTRUCTION

# Title
ICBC provides $80 million loan for Taliabu Island Iron Ore Project

# Description
In 2018, ICBC and PT Servindo Jaya Utama — a special purpose vehicle and wholly-owned subsidiary of Salim Group — signed an $80 million loan agreement for the Taliabu Iron Ore Project. The borrower was expected to use the proceeds of the loan to finance a commercial contract that it signed with Metallurgical Corporation of China (MCC) on September 9, 2015. The project involved the construction of a high-grade iron ore processing mill on Taliabu Island in North Maluku.   The project scope included the installation of a long-distance belt conveyor transportation system and concentration and tailing system, installation of mechanical equipment, pipeline and electric equipment, single and linkage commission, no-load and load test, etc. Upon completion, the mill was expected to produce 35 million tons of iron ore annually. Metallurgical Corporation of China (MCC) was the contractor responsible the implementation of the project. Construction started on January 18, 2016, and the project was completed on November 28, 2017.
justification: Project focuses on iron ore mining and processing, which is not directly related to energy transition minerals and has significant environmental impacts
evidence: Construction of high-grade iron ore processing mill, expected production of 35 million tons of iron ore annually, mining focus

title: ICBC provides $26.3 million loan for the Diamond Tower Project
description: In 2018, PT Bank ICBC Indonesia provided a US$26.3 million loan for the PT RHB MVP Classic Development Project, namely the Diamond Tower Building, a property development project owned by China Railway International Group (CRIG). The borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. The total project cost is US$68 million and it is located in the CBD Mega Kuningan business district in Jakarta.  On July 10, 2017, a signing ceremony of the official equity transfer agreement for the Jakarta Diamond Tower Project in Indonesia, which was invested by China Railway International Hong Kong Co., Ltd. and RHB MVP, the Indonesian company responsible for the general contracting of the project, was held in Jakarta. The ground-breaking ceremony of the Diamond Tower Project was held on December 9, 2019. Construction was still ongoing in February 2020. Due to the COVID-19 epidemic, work had stalled until August 13, when the project resumed production and started the construction of the first project pile foundation after the pile test.   Apartment units are available for pre-sale. The gross floor area of the project is 64,604 square meters and the building height is 198.75 meters. It is a multi-function building with office space, serviced apartments, and residential apartments, as well as supporting commercial facilities including cafes and convenience stores.   ACSET, a contractor in Indonesia, is a project partner. This project is the first real estate development in Indonesia by China Railway Group Limited (CREC), the parent company of CRIG. It is one of CREC’s practices of overseas investment under the Belt and Road Initiative.
staff_comments: The Chinese project title is 钻石塔房地产项目, also known as the Diamond Tower Real Estate Project or Terrace Diamond Building.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER MULTISECTOR

# Title
ICBC provides $26.3 million loan for the Diamond Tower Project

# Description
In 2018, PT Bank ICBC Indonesia provided a US$26.3 million loan for the PT RHB MVP Classic Development Project, namely the Diamond Tower Building, a property development project owned by China Railway International Group (CRIG). The borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. The total project cost is US$68 million and it is located in the CBD Mega Kuningan business district in Jakarta.  On July 10, 2017, a signing ceremony of the official equity transfer agreement for the Jakarta Diamond Tower Project in Indonesia, which was invested by China Railway International Hong Kong Co., Ltd. and RHB MVP, the Indonesian company responsible for the general contracting of the project, was held in Jakarta. The ground-breaking ceremony of the Diamond Tower Project was held on December 9, 2019. Construction was still ongoing in February 2020. Due to the COVID-19 epidemic, work had stalled until August 13, when the project resumed production and started the construction of the first project pile foundation after the pile test.   Apartment units are available for pre-sale. The gross floor area of the project is 64,604 square meters and the building height is 198.75 meters. It is a multi-function building with office space, serviced apartments, and residential apartments, as well as supporting commercial facilities including cafes and convenience stores.   ACSET, a contractor in Indonesia, is a project partner. This project is the first real estate development in Indonesia by China Railway Group Limited (CREC), the parent company of CRIG. It is one of CREC’s practices of overseas investment under the Belt and Road Initiative.
justification: Project is a mixed-use real estate development with no clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Multi-function building with office space, serviced apartments, residential apartments, and commercial facilities; no mention of energy or environmental features

title: ICBC provides $20 million working capital loan to joint venture PT Ritel Bersama Nasional
description: In 2018, the Corporate Banking branch of Bank ICBC Indonesia provided a working capital loan of US$20 million to PT Ritel Bersama Nasional (JD.ID). The facility will be used for the borrower's operational needs, mainly for inventory purchases. ICBC Indonesia's 2018 Annual Report states that this financing was carried out by Corporate Banking in 2018. The loan details of the project are unclear.   Ritel Bersama Nasional is a joint venture between Jingdong group (JD.com), one of China's largest online Business-to-Consumer (B2C) retailers, and Provident Capital group, the largest investment company in Southeast Asia. Provident has investments across a variety of industries, including telecommunications, infrastructure, mining, real estate, plantation, and biofuels.

title: Bank of China contributes $10.42 million to syndicated loan with PT Solusi Tunas Pratama for unspecified purposes (Linked to Project ID#89256, 71241, 89257, 89258, 89259, 89260, 8926)
description: On February 27, 2018, PT Solusi Tunas Pratama (STP) signed new 5-year loan facilities comprising USD 297 million term loan, IDR 3050 billion term loan, and IDR 800 billion revolving credit facilities to refinance its existing bank loans and bonds. ("STP Press Release") This project has a total contribution of $20.43 million from the Bank of China.  According to IJ Global, there were 3 term loans and 1 revolver signed in total, and all the tranches include financing from the Bank of China and China Construction Bank. In the $297 million term loan tranche, Bank of China and China Construction Bank contributed $10.24 million respectively; In the $20 million term loan tranche, BoC and CCB contributed $0.69 million respectively; In the $218 million term loan tranche, BoC and CCB contributed $7.52 million respectively; In the $57.3 million revolver tranche, they contributed $1.98 million respectively. In total they each contributed $20.43 million in the $592,3 million total transactions.  Facility six is led by six mandated lead arrangers and bookrunners — BNP Paribas, Citi, ING, Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group, Standard Chartered, and Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp. The USD term facility has an interest rate of LIBOR + 2.10% for onshore lenders, and LIBOR + 2.25% for offshore lenders, and the IDR loan facilities have an interest of LIBOR + 2.75% ("STP Press Release"). The payment of this loan for the year ended December 31, 2018, and amounted to Rp30,500 and USD3,170,000. ("Annual Report 2018.")  This project is linked to the other contributions from Bank of China and China Construction Bank: Project ID #89256, 71241, 89257, 89258, 89259, 89260, 89261.
staff_comments: 1. According to the IJGlobal report, the loan is signed on Jun 18, 2018 instead of Feb 27, 2018 as recorded in STP Press Release.
combined_text:
# Sector

# Description
On February 27, 2018, PT Solusi Tunas Pratama (STP) signed new 5-year loan facilities comprising USD 297 million term loan, IDR 3050 billion term loan, and IDR 800 billion revolving credit facilities to refinance its existing bank loans and bonds. ("STP Press Release") This project has a total contribution of $20.43 million from the Bank of China.  According to IJ Global, there were 3 term loans and 1 revolver signed in total, and all the tranches include financing from the Bank of China and China Construction Bank. In the $297 million term loan tranche, Bank of China and China Construction Bank contributed $10.24 million respectively; In the $20 million term loan tranche, BoC and CCB contributed $0.69 million respectively; In the $218 million term loan tranche, BoC and CCB contributed $7.52 million respectively; In the $57.3 million revolver tranche, they contributed $1.98 million respectively. In total they each contributed $20.43 million in the $592,3 million total transactions.  Facility six is led by six mandated lead arrangers and bookrunners — BNP Paribas, Citi, ING, Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group, Standard Chartered, and Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp. The USD term facility has an interest rate of LIBOR + 2.10% for onshore lenders, and LIBOR + 2.25% for offshore lenders, and the IDR loan facilities have an interest of LIBOR + 2.75% ("STP Press Release"). The payment of this loan for the year ended December 31, 2018, and amounted to Rp30,500 and USD3,170,000. ("Annual Report 2018.")  This project is linked to the other contributions from Bank of China and China Construction Bank: Project ID #89256, 71241, 89257, 89258, 89259, 89260, 89261.
justification: Project involves financial services (syndicated loan) with unspecified purposes, no clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Bank of China's contribution to syndicated loan, unspecified use of funds, financial transaction nature

title: ICBC contributed IDR 400B to syndicated loan for Balikpapan-Samarinda Toll Road (Linked to ID #61324)
description: On December 21, 2018, Bank ICBC Indonesia provided IDR 400 billion in a syndicated loan to PT Jasamarga Balikpapan Samarinda (JBS) for the construction of the Balikpapan-Samarinda Toll Road Project in East Kalimantan. Based on the Deed of Credit Agreement No. 88 and No. 89 dated December 21, 2018, of Notary Ashoya Ratam, S.H.M.Kn, JBS, a subsidiary, entered into a syndication loan agreement with 14 banks. The maximum credit facility given is Rp6,980,000,000 and the loan facility period is 15 years from the date of signing the agreement. The loan bears interest at an average of 3-month time deposit rate published by syndicated banks plus a margin of 4.25% during construction time and 4.00% from the date of toll operation period.   The banks participating in the syndicated loan include PT Bank Mandiri (Persero) Tbk, PT Bank Negara Indonesia (Persero) Tbk (“BNI”), PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia (Persero) Tbk (“BRI”), PT Sarana Multi Infrastruktur (“SMI”), PT Bank ICBC Indonesia (“ICBC”), PT Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Timur Tbk, PT Bank Pembangunan Dareah Papua, PT Bank Pembangunan Daerah Kalimantan Selatan, PT Lembaga Pembiayaan Ekspor Indonesia (‘LPEI”), PT Bank Mega Tbk, PT Bank Syariah Mandiri, PT Bank Negara Indonesia Syariah, PT Bank Muamalat Indonesia Tbk, and PT Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Barat Syariah.  The toll road has a length of 90.22km and will connect the cities of Balikpapan and Samarinda in the East Kalimantan province. The project is developed by Jasa Marga Balikpapan Samarinda, a consortium consisting of Jasa Marga (55%), Wijaya Karya (15%), Pembangunan Perumahan (15%), and Bangun Tjipta Sarana (15%). The construction was started on 12 January 2011 but halted in 2012 because of a financial shortage. In November 2015, President Joko Widodo relaunched the construction of the toll road ("Balikpapan–Samarinda Toll Road"). China Eximbank provided an export buyer's credit loan in 2015 for this project (See ID #61324).   The Balikpapan-Samarinda toll road has a total length of 97.27 Km and is divided into five sections. Section 1: starts from KM 13 to Samboja along 21.95 kilometers (72,014 ft); Section 2: from Samboja to Muara Jawa along 30.05 kilometers (98,589 ft), Section 3: from Muara Jawa to Palaran along 18.2 kilometers (59,711 ft), Section 4: from Palaran to Samarinda is 17.15 kilometers (56,266 ft) long, Section 5: from Km 13 Balikpapan to Manggar is 11.09 kilometers (36,385 ft) long.  Sections 2, 3, and 4 were completed on December 17, 2019, while Sections 1 and 5 were expected to be finished in 2020 ("Balikpapan-Samarinda toll road inauguration: Constructing the new capital city gradually"). On August 24, 2021, President Joko Widodo inaugurated Section 1 and Section 5 at the Manggar Toll Gate (GT) in Balikpapan, East Kalimantan.
staff_comments: 1. The interest rate of 7.038% is estimated using the 3-month LIBOR rate in December 2018 (2.788%) and adding a 4.25% margin.
combined_text:

The maximum credit facility given is Rp6,980,000,000 and the loan facility period is 15 years from the date of signing the agreement. The loan bears interest at an average of 3-month time deposit rate published by syndicated banks plus a margin of 4.25% during construction time and 4.00% from the date of toll operation period.   The banks participating in the syndicated loan include PT Bank Mandiri (Persero) Tbk, PT Bank Negara Indonesia (Persero) Tbk (“BNI”), PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia (Persero) Tbk (“BRI”), PT Sarana Multi Infrastruktur (“SMI”), PT Bank ICBC Indonesia (“ICBC”), PT Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Timur Tbk, PT Bank Pembangunan Dareah Papua, PT Bank Pembangunan Daerah Kalimantan Selatan, PT Lembaga Pembiayaan Ekspor Indonesia (‘LPEI”), PT Bank Mega Tbk, PT Bank Syariah Mandiri, PT Bank Negara Indonesia Syariah, PT Bank Muamalat Indonesia Tbk, and PT Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Barat Syariah.  The toll road has a length of 90.22km and will connect the cities of Balikpapan and Samarinda in the East Kalimantan province. The construction was started on 12 January 2011 but halted in 2012 because of a financial shortage. In November 2015, President Joko Widodo relaunched the construction of the toll road ("Balikpapan–Samarinda Toll Road"). China Eximbank provided an export buyer's credit loan in 2015 for this project (See ID #61324).   The Balikpapan-Samarinda toll road has a total length of 97.27 Km and is divided into five sections. Section 1: starts from KM 13 to Samboja along 21.95 kilometers (72,014 ft); Section 2: from Samboja to Muara Jawa along 30.05 kilometers (98,589 ft), Section 3: from Muara Jawa to Palaran along 18.2 kilometers (59,711 ft), Section 4: from Palaran to Samarinda is 17.15 kilometers (56,266 ft) long, Section 5: from Km 13 Balikpapan to Manggar is 11.09 kilometers (36,385 ft) long. On August 24, 2021, President Joko Widodo inaugurated Section 1 and Section 5 at the Manggar Toll Gate (GT) in Balikpapan, East Kalimantan.
justification: The project is a toll road construction project with no direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Toll road construction, transportation infrastructure, no mention of energy or environmental components

title: Export-Import Bank of China provides overseas investment loan to support projects in Morowali Industrial Park in Indonesia (Linked to ID #85817 and #61986)
description: On October 2nd, 2013, Shanghai Dingxin Investment (Group) Col, Ltd. — a subsidiary of Tsingshan Steel — and Bintang Delapan Group signed an agreement to establish a joint venture, PT. Indonesia Morowali Industrial Park (IMIP), as the developer of the China-Indonesia Economic and Trade Cooperation Zone Indonesia Morowali Industrial Park (IMIP) in Sulawesi Province (referred to as 中国印尼综合产业园区青山园区 or 印尼经贸合作区青山园区 in Chinese). Shanghai Dingxin Investment (Group) Co., Ltd. holds 66.25% shares and Indonesia PT Bintangdelapan Group holds 33.75% shares.  In 2018, the Export-Import Bank of China agreed to provide an overseas investment loan (境外投资贷款) to Shanghai Dingxin Investment Group for projects in the Morowali Industrial Park ("进出口银行上海分行助力印尼青山工业园区建设"). The overseas investment loan helps promote the development of the technical level of Indonesian industry, but also promotes the export of China's mechanical and electrical equipment, and improves China's ability to guarantee resources such as nickel and chromium. In recent years, the Shanghai Branch of the Export-Import Bank of China has cooperated closely with Shanghai Dingxin. It has used overseas investment and loans to support the construction of the fourth (see ID #85817) and sixth key projects in the park. The transaction amount and details about the sixth key project are unclear.  This project is part of China's Belt and Road Initiative (BRI). The total planned land area of ​​the park is about 2000 hectares. By 2018 there have been four secondary base stations, 10 satellite TV reception systems, and a 30,000-ton terminal built as well as eight 5,000-ton dock berths and more than 70 residential houses. As of the end of September 2016, the actual investment in the park and the park project totaled approximately US$2.5 billion ("【经贸合作区】中国印尼综合产业园区青山园区"). Construction commenced in late 2013 ("INDONESIA MOROWALI INDUSTRIAL PARK").   China Development Bank also provided funding for the projects in the industrial park (See ID #61986).
staff_comments: 1. The Chinese project title is 中国印尼综合产业园区青山园区 or 青山园区.2. This loan is likely separate from the overseas investment loan China Eximbank provided in 2017, captured in ID #85817.
combined_text:
# Sector
BUSINESS AND OTHER SERVICES

# Title
Export-Import Bank of China provides overseas investment loan to support projects in Morowali Industrial Park in Indonesia (Linked to ID #85817 and #61986)

# Description
On October 2nd, 2013, Shanghai Dingxin Investment (Group) Col, Ltd. — a subsidiary of Tsingshan Steel — and Bintang Delapan Group signed an agreement to establish a joint venture, PT. Indonesia Morowali Industrial Park (IMIP), as the developer of the China-Indonesia Economic and Trade Cooperation Zone Indonesia Morowali Industrial Park (IMIP) in Sulawesi Province (referred to as 中国印尼综合产业园区青山园区 or 印尼经贸合作区青山园区 in Chinese). Shanghai Dingxin Investment (Group) Co., Ltd. holds 66.25% shares and Indonesia PT Bintangdelapan Group holds 33.75% shares.  In 2018, the Export-Import Bank of China agreed to provide an overseas investment loan (境外投资贷款) to Shanghai Dingxin Investment Group for projects in the Morowali Industrial Park ("进出口银行上海分行助力印尼青山工业园区建设"). The overseas investment loan helps promote the development of the technical level of Indonesian industry, but also promotes the export of China's mechanical and electrical equipment, and improves China's ability to guarantee resources such as nickel and chromium. In recent years, the Shanghai Branch of the Export-Import Bank of China has cooperated closely with Shanghai Dingxin. It has used overseas investment and loans to support the construction of the fourth (see ID #85817) and sixth key projects in the park. The transaction amount and details about the sixth key project are unclear.  This project is part of China's Belt and Road Initiative (BRI). The total planned land area of ​​the park is about 2000 hectares. By 2018 there have been four secondary base stations, 10 satellite TV reception systems, and a 30,000-ton terminal built as well as eight 5,000-ton dock berths and more than 70 residential houses. As of the end of September 2016, the actual investment in the park and the park project totaled approximately US$2.5 billion ("【经贸合作区】中国印尼综合产业园区青山园区"). Construction commenced in late 2013 ("INDONESIA MOROWALI INDUSTRIAL PARK").   China Development Bank also provided funding for the projects in the industrial park (See ID #61986).
justification: Project focuses on industrial park development with emphasis on nickel and chromium resources, which are critical for energy transition technologies
evidence: Mentions improving China's ability to guarantee resources such as nickel and chromium, industrial park development with significant infrastructure investments

title: China Eximbank provides $1.26 billion loan for 1240MW Bangko Tengah (SS-8) Mine Mouth Power Plant Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#69235)
description: On May 24, 2018, China Eximbank and PT Huadian Bukit Asam Power (HBAP) — a special purpose vehicle and joint venture between PT Bukit Asam Tbk (45% ownership stake) and China Huadian Hong Kong Company Ltd (55% ownership stake) — signed a $1.26 billion loan agreement for the 1240MW Bangko Tengah (SS-8) Mine Mouth Power Plant Construction Project. The loan carries the following borrowing terms: a 15-year maturity, a 5 year grace period, and an interest rate of LIBOR + a 2.85% margin. The $1.59 billion project is being implemented as an Independent Power Project (IPP) and financed according to a 75:25 debt-to-equity ratio. The transaction also appears to be backed by a Sinosure credit insurance and/or investment insurance policy.  The purpose of the project is to construct a 1,240 megawatt (MW) coal-fired power station — with two 620MW generators (Unit 1 and Unit 2) — near the Tanjung Enim coal mine in South Sumatra Province (exact locational coordinates: -3.838679, 103.804133). The project site is located 2 km away from the Central Banko coal mine in Muara Enim, South Sumatra, Indonesia. The power plant’s coal-fired power generation units will be equipped with a super-critical boiler along with a high-efficiency steam turbine and a generator. The plant will also be fitted with a flue gas desulphurisation (FGD) system to control emissions.The Sumsel-8 power plant will consume up to 5.4 million tonnes (Mt) of coal a year, which will be sourced through a 1.5km-long enclosed conveyor belt from the Banko Tengah coal mine operated by PTBA in the Tanjung Enim area. The project also involves the construction of a 45 km transmission line from the power plant to the PLN substation in Muara Enim.  On November 7, 2015, South Sumatra Governor Alex Noerdin attended a groundbreaking ceremony at the project site. Then, on October 19, 2017, HBAP signed a 25-year power purchase agreement (PPA) with Perusahaan Listrik Negara (PLN), which is an Indonesian government-owned corporation that has a monopoly on electricity distribution in Indonesia and generates the majority of the country's electrical power. China Huadian Hongkong Company Ltd. is the EPC contractor responsible for implementation. Inter World Steel Mills Indonesia and Mutiara Indah Anugrah are also involved as subcontractors. Inter World Steel Mills Indonesia has provided thesteel solutions for the Sumsel-8 coal-fired power project, while the key equipment including boilers, turbines and generators were supplied by contractors based in China. Mutiara Indah Anugrah, a construction company based in Indonesia, was contracted to perform construction and installation works for the project in 2019. Construction commenced in June 2018. By the end of 2019, the project had achieved a 22% completion rate. In March 2020, the project's sponsor declared force majeure and stated that project would be delayed as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. Unit 1 was originally expected to reach its commercial operations date (COD) in December 2021, while Unit 2 was originally expected to reach its commercial operations date (COD) in March 2022. As of November 2021, the project was 92.84% complete.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the South Sumatra 8 Power Plant Construction Project or Sumsel-8 Power Plant Construction Project.2. This project is linked to Project ID#69235, which captures the equity contribution from from China Huadian Hongkong Company Ltd.3. AidData has estimated the all-in interest rate by adding 2.85% to the average 6-month LIBOR rate in May 2018 (2.50%).
combined_text:
# Sector
ENERGY

# Title
China Eximbank provides $1.26 billion loan for 1240MW Bangko Tengah (SS-8) Mine Mouth Power Plant Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#69235)

# Description
On May 24, 2018, China Eximbank and PT Huadian Bukit Asam Power (HBAP) — a special purpose vehicle and joint venture between PT Bukit Asam Tbk (45% ownership stake) and China Huadian Hong Kong Company Ltd (55% ownership stake) — signed a $1.26 billion loan agreement for the 1240MW Bangko Tengah (SS-8) Mine Mouth Power Plant Construction Project. The loan carries the following borrowing terms: a 15-year maturity, a 5 year grace period, and an interest rate of LIBOR + a 2.85% margin. The $1.59 billion project is being implemented as an Independent Power Project (IPP) and financed according to a 75:25 debt-to-equity ratio. The transaction also appears to be backed by a Sinosure credit insurance and/or investment insurance policy.  The purpose of the project is to construct a 1,240 megawatt (MW) coal-fired power station — with two 620MW generators (Unit 1 and Unit 2) — near the Tanjung Enim coal mine in South Sumatra Province (exact locational coordinates: -3.838679, 103.804133). The project site is located 2 km away from the Central Banko coal mine in Muara Enim, South Sumatra, Indonesia. The power plant’s coal-fired power generation units will be equipped with a super-critical boiler along with a high-efficiency steam turbine and a generator. The plant will also be fitted with a flue gas desulphurisation (FGD) system to control emissions.The Sumsel-8 power plant will consume up to 5.4 million tonnes (Mt) of coal a year, which will be sourced through a 1.5km-long enclosed conveyor belt from the Banko Tengah coal mine operated by PTBA in the Tanjung Enim area. The project also involves the construction of a 45 km transmission line from the power plant to the PLN substation in Muara Enim.  On November 7, 2015, South Sumatra Governor Alex Noerdin attended a groundbreaking ceremony at the project site. Then, on October 19, 2017, HBAP signed a 25-year power purchase agreement (PPA) with Perusahaan Listrik Negara (PLN), which is an Indonesian government-owned corporation that has a monopoly on electricity distribution in Indonesia and generates the majority of the country's electrical power. China Huadian Hongkong Company Ltd. is the EPC contractor responsible for implementation. Inter World Steel Mills Indonesia and Mutiara Indah Anugrah are also involved as subcontractors. Inter World Steel Mills Indonesia has provided thesteel solutions for the Sumsel-8 coal-fired power project, while the key equipment including boilers, turbines and generators were supplied by contractors based in China. Mutiara Indah Anugrah, a construction company based in Indonesia, was contracted to perform construction and installation works for the project in 2019. Construction commenced in June 2018. By the end of 2019, the project had achieved a 22% completion rate. In March 2020, the project's sponsor declared force majeure and stated that project would be delayed as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. Unit 1 was originally expected to reach its commercial operations date (COD) in December 2021, while Unit 2 was originally expected to reach its commercial operations date (COD) in March 2022. As of November 2021, the project was 92.84% complete.
justification: Primary purpose is coal-fired power generation, which significantly increases fossil fuel dependency and environmental impact
evidence: 1240MW coal-fired power station, super-critical boiler, high-efficiency steam turbine, coal consumption of 5.4 million tonnes per year, flue gas desulphurisation system

title: ICBC reschedules debt for Kota Ayodhya, Paddington Heights Apartment, and Prominence Office Tower project (2018) (Linked to Project ID#66251 and #86572)
description: On October 8, 2015, ICBC Indonesia and PT Alam Sutera Realty Tbk — a private Indonesian real estate company — signed an IDR 790 billion loan agreement for the construction of Kota Ayodhya, Paddington Heights Apartment, and Prominence Office Tower, which are real estate projects of PT Alam Sutera Realty Tbk. According to Credit Agreement No. 15 dated October 8, 2015 and amended by deed No. 43 dated February 2, 2017, between ICBC Indonesia and PT Alam Sutera Realty Tbk, a maximum of IDR 363,840,000,000 was provided for the Kota Ayodhya Apartment. The loan carried a maturity of 5 years, a grace period of 12 months, and an interest rate of 12% per annum (floating) (see Project ID#66251).  The collateral for the bank loan includes the mortgage right of a land area of 49,856 square meters in the Kec. Cikokol, Tangerang (source: PT Alam Sutera Realty Tbk. dan Entitas Anak/ and its Subsidiaries). In October 2015, PT Alam Sutera Realty Tbk increased its borrowing from ICBC Indonesia to IDR 790 billion for project expansion activities. A letter from ICBC Indonesia dated November 14, 2016, changed the credit facility interest rate to 11.50% per annum. Then, a letter from ICBC Indonesia dated February 6, 2018, changed the facility interest rate to 9.50% per annum. As of December 31, 2019 and December 31, 2018, the balance of the loan amounted to IDR 75,364,755,000 and IDR 164,920,167,000, respectively.   This project entry captures the rescheduling of the debt, specifically the change in interest rate from 11.5% to 9.5%. The 2016 interest rate change from 12% to 11.5% is captured in project #86572.  Kota Ayodhya is an apartment complex — consisting of four 24-story apartment towers, namely Jade Tower, Coral Tower, Sienna Tower, and Indigo Tower — that is located in the heart of Tangerang about 7 kilometers away from Alam Sutera and 2.5 kilometers away from Serpong Toll (Jakarta – Merak). Its groundbreaking ceremony took place on April 16, 2014. As of December 31, 2018, construction of all four Kota Ayodhya towers was complete.     Paddington Heights is a high-end apartment located between Bina Nusantara University and Silkwood Residences. Its completion was originally scheduled for October 2016. however, it was ultimately completed ahead of schedule in July 2016.     The Prominence Office Tower is a 30-floor high office building in Tangerang. Its groundbreaking ceremony took place in May 2013 and its construction was completed in December 2016.
staff_comments: The start and end dates coded for this project correspond to the earliest construction date of the three buildings (May 2013 for the Prominence Office Tower) and the latest completion date of the three buildings (December 31, 2018 for the Kota Ayodhya apartment complex).

justification: Project involves real estate development (apartments and office tower) with no clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of apartment complexes and office tower, no mention of energy or environmental components
